hero.title: We're teachers too. We get it.
hero.subtitle: Currico was born out of our own frustration with lesson prep. We built the tool we always wished existed.

mission.title: Why we started Currico
mission.paragraph1: Honestly? Because we were tired. Tired of spending our Sundays searching for worksheets. Tired of adapting German materials to Swiss standards. Tired of feeling like prep time was eating into our lives.
mission.paragraph2: So we asked ourselves: what if there was a place built by Swiss teachers, for Swiss teachers? A place where you can find quality materials in minutes, not hours. Where everything already fits the Lehrplan 21. Where you don't have to reinvent the wheel every week.
mission.paragraph3: That's Currico. It's not a faceless platform. It's a small team with a big heart, working to give you back the time you deserve — for your students, your family, and yourself.

value1.title: Your time is precious
value1.description: Find what you need, print it, teach it. We want your evenings and weekends to be yours again.

value2.title: Made for Switzerland
value2.description: No more adapting foreign content. Everything here is designed for Swiss classrooms and the Lehrplan 21.

value3.title: Quality you can trust
value3.description: Every material is reviewed by real teachers. We'd rather have fewer great materials than a flood of mediocre ones.

origin.title: Our story
origin.paragraph1: It started with a simple idea between two friends: what if we could make each other's school prep easier? Simon, with his background in education, and Laurent, with his tech skills, started sharing materials and building tools.
origin.paragraph2: That small experiment turned into Currico. Today, we're still the same two people — passionate about education, obsessed with making things simple, and always happy to hear from you. We read every message, we listen to every suggestion, and we build what you actually need.

founders.title: The people behind Currico
founders.subtitle: No corporate team. Just two guys who care about making your school day easier.

founder1.name: Simon Wachter
founder1.bio: I know what it's like to stand in front of a class and wish you had better materials. That's why I make sure everything on Currico is practical, classroom-tested, and aligned with what Swiss teachers actually need.

founder2.name: Laurent Zoccoletti
founder2.bio: I build the platform so it just works — fast, simple, no headaches. My job is to make sure technology gets out of your way and lets you focus on what you do best: teaching.

founders.story: We started Currico at a kitchen table, fueled by coffee and a shared belief: teachers deserve better tools. We're not a startup chasing investors. We're two people building something we genuinely believe in — and we'd love for you to be part of it.
founders.highlight: Got a question, an idea, or just want to say hi? We'd genuinely love to hear from you.

cta.title: Come join us
cta.subtitle: Hundreds of Swiss teachers are already saving hours every week. Give it a try — it's free to start.

sellerTerms.pageSubtitle: Please read these terms carefully before becoming a seller on Currico

overview.title: 1. Overview
overview.content: These Seller Terms govern your use of Currico as a seller of teaching materials. By accepting these terms and completing the seller onboarding process, you agree to be bound by these conditions.

platformFee.title: 2. Platform Fee
platformFee.content: Currico charges a platform fee of 30% on all sales. This means:

breakdown.platform: Currico retains 30% as a platform fee
breakdown.example: Example: For a CHF 10.00 material, you receive CHF 7.00

platformFee.note: Payment processing fees (Stripe fees) are included in the platform fee and are not charged separately to you.

payouts.title: 3. Payouts
payouts.content: Payouts are processed through Stripe Connect. Key details:

details.schedule: Payouts are processed automatically on a rolling basis (typically 2-7 business days after a sale)
details.minimum: There is no minimum payout threshold
details.currency: All transactions are in Swiss Francs (CHF)
details.account: You must complete Stripe's identity verification to receive payouts

contentPolicies.title: 4. Content Policies
contentPolicies.content: As a seller, you agree that all materials you upload:

requirements.original: Are your original work or you have the rights to sell them
requirements.appropriate: Are appropriate for educational use in Swiss schools
requirements.quality: Meet our quality standards for teaching materials
requirements.lp21: Are properly aligned with Lehrplan 21 where applicable

copyrightWarranty.title: 5. Copyright Warranty & Indemnification
copyrightWarranty.content: As a seller, you warrant and agree that:

warranties.ownership: You are the sole author and owner of all materials you upload, or you have obtained all necessary rights and licenses to sell them
warranties.noInfringement: Your materials do not infringe any third-party copyrights, trademarks, or other intellectual property rights
warranties.noThirdParty: Your materials do not contain content copied from textbooks, websites, or other sources without proper authorization

indemnification.title: Indemnification (Freistellung)
indemnification.content: You agree to indemnify, defend, and hold harmless Currico, its operators, employees, and affiliates from and against any and all claims, damages, losses, costs, and expenses (including reasonable legal fees) arising from or related to:

items.infringement: Any claim that your materials infringe the intellectual property rights of any third party
items.breach: Any breach of your warranties under these terms
items.content: The content, quality, or accuracy of your teaching materials

noticeTakedown.title: 6. Notice and Takedown Procedure
noticeTakedown.content: Currico respects intellectual property rights and responds to proper notices of claimed copyright infringement.

procedure.title: How to Report Copyright Infringement
procedure.content: If you believe that content on Currico infringes your copyright, please send a notice to info@currico.ch containing:

items.identify: Identification of the copyrighted work you claim has been infringed
items.location: The URL or other specific location on Currico where the allegedly infringing material is located
items.contact: Your contact information (name, address, phone number, email)
items.statement: A statement that you have a good faith belief that the use is not authorized by the copyright owner

response.title: Our Response
response.content: Upon receiving a valid notice, Currico will promptly remove or disable access to the allegedly infringing content and notify the seller. Sellers may submit a counter-notice if they believe the takedown was made in error.

prohibited.title: 7. Prohibited Content
prohibited.content: The following content is strictly prohibited:

items.copyright: Copyrighted material you don't have rights to sell
items.plagiarized: Plagiarized or copied content from other sources
items.malicious: Files containing malware or malicious code
items.personal: Content containing personal data of students or others

responsibilities.title: 8. Seller Responsibilities
responsibilities.content: As a seller, you are responsible for:

items.accuracy: Ensuring the accuracy of your material descriptions
items.support: Responding to buyer questions about your materials
items.updates: Updating materials if errors are discovered
items.taxes: Handling your own tax obligations for income earned
items.compliance: Complying with Swiss education standards and regulations

rights.remove: Remove content that violates these terms or is subject to a valid copyright complaint
rights.suspend: Suspend or terminate seller accounts for policy violations or repeated copyright infringements
rights.withhold: Withhold payouts if fraudulent activity is suspected or pending resolution of copyright claims

changes.title: 10. Changes to Terms
changes.content: We may update these terms from time to time. Significant changes will be communicated via email. Continued use of the platform after changes constitutes acceptance of the new terms.

tooltips.title: Choose a clear, descriptive title that describes the content of your material. A good title helps other teachers find your materials.

tooltips.language: Select the main language of the content. This helps with search and filtering.
tooltips.materialType: Select the main format of your file. PDF files are most commonly used and automatically receive a preview.
tooltips.cycle: The cycle defines the age level according to Lehrplan 21. Cycle 1: KG-2nd grade, Cycle 2: 3rd-6th grade, Cycle 3: 7th-9th grade.
tooltips.subject: Select the main subject your material fits. Available subjects depend on the selected cycle.

tooltips.competencies: Select the Lehrplan 21 competencies that your material covers. The more precisely you assign, the better teachers will find your materials.
tooltips.priceType: Decide whether your material should be free or paid. Free materials reach more users, paid ones generate income.
tooltips.price: Set the selling price in CHF. You receive 70% of the selling price, 30% is platform fee. Minimum price is CHF 1, maximum CHF 50.
tooltips.editable: Enable this if buyers should be able to edit the file (e.g., Word documents). Usually not needed for PDF files.
tooltips.files: Upload your main file(s). Supported formats: PDF, Word, PowerPoint, Excel. Maximum file size: 50 MB per file.
tooltips.preview: Optional: Upload a custom preview image. For PDF files, a preview is automatically created from the first page.

introduction.title: 1. Introduction
introduction.content: Welcome to Currico. By accessing or using our platform, you agree to be bound by these Terms of Service. Currico is a Swiss platform connecting educators to buy, sell, and share high-quality teaching materials aligned with the Swiss curriculum (Lehrplan 21).

marketplaceModel.title: 2. Marketplace Model
marketplaceModel.content: Currico operates as an online marketplace (Vermittlungsplattform) and acts solely as an intermediary between sellers and buyers. Important clarifications:

items.intermediary: Currico merely facilitates the connection between teachers who sell materials (Sellers) and teachers who purchase materials (Buyers)
items.contract: The purchase contract for teaching materials is concluded directly between the Buyer and the Seller, not with Currico
items.noParty: Currico is not a party to any sales contract and does not become the owner of any teaching materials at any time
items.sellerResponsibility: The Seller is solely responsible for the content, quality, accuracy, and legal compliance of their teaching materials
items.disputes: Any disputes regarding purchased materials must be resolved between Buyer and Seller directly, though Currico may assist in mediation
items.opinion: All uploaded teaching materials represent solely the personal opinion of the respective author. Currico only performs formal review and accepts no liability for the accuracy of the content

account.title: 3. Account Terms
account.content: To use certain features of Currico, you must create an account. You agree to:

items.accurate: Provide accurate and complete information during registration
items.secure: Keep your password secure and not share your account credentials
items.age: Be at least 18 years old or have parental consent to use the platform
items.oneAccount: Maintain only one account per person

acceptableUse.title: 4. Acceptable Use
acceptableUse.content: You agree to use Currico only for lawful purposes and in accordance with these terms. You must not:

items.lawful: Use the platform for any illegal or unauthorized purpose
items.noAbuse: Harass, abuse, or harm other users
items.noScraping: Attempt to scrape, copy, or redistribute content without permission
items.respectOthers: Infringe on the intellectual property rights of others

intellectualProperty.title: 5. Intellectual Property
intellectualProperty.content: The structure and functions of the Currico platform are protected by copyright. All rights reserved. Teaching materials uploaded by sellers remain the property of their respective creators, who grant buyers a limited license to use them for educational purposes. By uploading files, the author authorizes their publication on the platform. The author is liable for any claims by third parties arising from copyright infringement or other legal violations.

purchases.title: 6. Purchases and Downloads
purchases.content: When you purchase teaching materials on Currico:

items.personal: You receive a personal, non-transferable license to use the materials
items.noRedistribution: You may not redistribute, resell, or share purchased materials
items.refunds: Refund requests are handled on a case-by-case basis through our support team

digitalWithdrawal.title: 7. Right of Withdrawal for Digital Content
digitalWithdrawal.content: For digital products (downloads), the following applies under Swiss law and EU consumer protection regulations:

items.noWithdrawal: You expressly agree that digital content will be made available immediately after purchase
items.waiver: By completing your purchase and initiating the download, you acknowledge that you lose your right of withdrawal (Widerrufsrecht) once the download begins
items.consent: Before completing any purchase of digital content, you will be asked to confirm: 'I agree that the digital content is available immediately and I acknowledge that I lose my right of withdrawal once the download starts'
items.exception: This waiver does not apply if the downloaded content is defective or materially different from the description

liability.title: 8. Limitation of Liability
liability.content: All liability of Currico is excluded to the extent legally permissible. Currico provides the platform 'as is' and makes no warranties regarding the quality, accuracy, or fitness of teaching materials sold by third-party sellers. As an intermediary, Currico is not liable for any indirect, incidental, or consequential damages arising from the content of teaching materials. Currico's liability is limited to cases of gross negligence or intentional misconduct. Currico offers all services free of charge or in exchange for voluntary contributions; voluntary payments or premium offerings do not create any service guarantees.

governingLaw.title: 9. Governing Law and Jurisdiction
governingLaw.content: These Terms of Service are governed by the laws of Switzerland. The application of the United Nations Convention on Contracts for the International Sale of Goods (CISG / Vienna Convention) is excluded. The exclusive place of jurisdiction for all disputes arising from or in connection with these terms is Zurich, Switzerland.

availability.title: 10. Platform Availability
availability.content: Currico strives to make the platform available around the clock on a best-effort basis. However, there is no entitlement to permanent availability. Currico reserves the right to restrict, interrupt, or discontinue access to the platform at any time without prior notice.

items.noGuarantee: No guarantee is provided for uninterrupted availability of the platform
items.maintenance: Maintenance work may lead to temporary restrictions
items.noLiability: Currico is not liable for damages resulting from platform unavailability

dataLocation.title: 11. Data Storage
dataLocation.content: All data is stored and processed on servers in Switzerland (Zurich location). Currico is committed to complying with applicable Swiss data protection regulations.

extendedLiability.title: 12. Extended Liability Disclaimers
extendedLiability.content: In addition to the limitations of liability mentioned in Section 8, the following applies:

items.dataLoss: Currico is not liable for data loss of any kind, particularly not for the loss of uploaded materials
items.malware: Currico does not warrant that the platform is free from viruses, malware, or other harmful components
items.thirdPartyMisuse: Currico is not liable for misuse of the platform by third parties
items.emailConfidentiality: Email communication is not encrypted and therefore not confidential. Currico assumes no liability for damages arising from the use of email
items.noGuarantees: Use of the platform is at your own risk. No guarantees are made regarding functionality, freedom from errors, or fitness for a particular purpose
items.indirectDamages: Currico is not liable for indirect damages, lost profits, data loss, or other consequential damages

userContentLiability.title: 13. Liability for User Content
userContentLiability.content: Users are solely responsible for all content they upload. Currico is entitled to store users' IP addresses and to forward them to the competent authorities in case of legal violations.

items.authorResponsibility: The author is solely responsible for the content of uploaded materials
items.ipStorage: Currico stores IP addresses to identify users in case of legal violations
items.legalAction: Currico reserves the right to take legal action in case of legal violations and to forward relevant data to authorities
items.removal: Currico is entitled to remove content at any time without giving reasons
items.noNotice: Removal of content occurs without prior notice and does not give rise to any claim for damages

prohibitedContent.title: 14. Prohibited Content
prohibitedContent.content: The following content may not be published on the platform:

what.content: Cookies are small text files that are stored on your device when you visit a website. They help websites remember your preferences and improve your browsing experience. Cookies can be 'session' cookies (deleted when you close your browser) or 'persistent' cookies (remain until they expire or you delete them).

howWeUse.title: 2. How We Use Cookies
howWeUse.content: We use cookies to provide essential website functionality, remember your preferences (like language settings), keep you signed in, and understand how visitors use our platform so we can improve it.

essential.title: Essential Cookies

cookies.session: Keeps you signed in to your account

analytics.title: Analytics Cookies

managing.title: 4. Managing Your Cookie Preferences

faqPage.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faqPage.subtitle: Find answers to the most common questions about Currico

q1.question: What is Currico?
q1.answer: Currico is a Swiss platform where teachers can buy and sell high-quality teaching materials. All materials are specifically designed for the Swiss Lehrplan 21 curriculum and created by experienced teachers.

q2.question: Who is Currico for?
q2.answer: Currico is aimed at all teachers in Switzerland - from primary to secondary level. Our materials are available for Cycle 1, 2, and 3 and cover all subject areas of the Lehrplan 21.

q3.question: Why Currico instead of other platforms?
q3.answer: Currico is 100% focused on Switzerland. All materials use Swiss spelling (ss instead of ß), are aligned with Lehrplan 21, and prices are in Swiss Francs. Additionally, our server is hosted in Switzerland.

q4.question: Do I need to create an account?
q4.answer: You don't need an account to browse and view material previews. However, a free registration is required to buy or sell materials.

q5.question: How can I contact support?
q5.answer: You can reach us via the contact form on our website or by email. We strive to respond to all inquiries within 24 hours.

q1.question: What file formats are available?
q1.answer: Most materials are available as PDF and/or Word documents (DOCX). The exact format is indicated for each material. Word documents can be edited after download.

q2.question: Are the materials editable?
q2.answer: That depends on the file format. Word documents (DOCX) are fully editable. PDF files cannot be edited directly but are ideal for printing.

q3.question: Can I share materials with colleagues?
q3.answer: The license is valid for a single teacher. Sharing with colleagues or uploading to school networks is not permitted. For school licenses, please contact us directly.

q4.question: How does payment work?
q4.answer: We accept credit cards (Visa, Mastercard), TWINT, and for schools also invoice with QR code. All prices are in Swiss Francs including VAT.

q5.question: Can I return materials?
q5.answer: Since these are digital products, returns are generally not possible after download. For technical problems or if the material doesn't match the description, please contact our support.

q1.question: How can I sell materials?
q1.answer: Register as a seller, connect your account with Stripe for payouts, and upload your materials. After a brief review, your materials will be published.

q2.question: What is the commission rate?
q2.answer: Currico keeps 30% of the sale price as a platform fee. You receive 70% of each sale directly to your bank account.

q3.question: When will I receive my payout?
q3.answer: Payouts are processed automatically via Stripe once your balance reaches CHF 50. The transfer to your bank account usually takes 2-3 business days.

q4.question: What are the requirements for materials?
q4.answer: Your materials must be original, consider the Lehrplan 21, and use Swiss spelling (ss instead of ß). Copyrighted content from third parties is not allowed.

q5.question: What does LP21-compliant mean?
q5.answer: LP21-compliant means your material is aligned with the competencies of the Lehrplan 21. When uploading, you can select the corresponding competency codes (e.g., MA.1.A.1).

q1.question: How do I download purchased materials?
q1.answer: After purchase, you'll find all acquired materials in your Library under 'My Account'. You can re-download the files there at any time.

q2.question: I'm having download problems. What should I do?
q2.answer: First try reloading the page or using a different browser. If the problem persists, please contact our support with your order number.

q3.question: Is my data secure?
q3.answer: Yes, we take data protection very seriously. Our servers are located in Switzerland, and we strictly comply with Swiss data protection law (nDSG) as well as GDPR. More details in our Privacy Policy.

q4.question: Which browsers are supported?
q4.answer: Currico works with all modern browsers: Chrome, Firefox, Safari, and Edge. We recommend always using the latest version of your browser.

q5.question: Does Currico work on mobile devices?
q5.answer: Yes, Currico is fully responsive and works on smartphones and tablets. You can browse and purchase materials on any device. However, for editing Word documents, we recommend using a computer.

privacyPage.title: Privacy Policy
privacyPage.intro: The following statement provides an overview of how Currico protects your data, what type of data is collected for what purpose, and what rights you have. Currico is subject to Swiss data protection law (nDSG, effective September 1, 2023) and - where applicable - other data protection regulations such as the General Data Protection Regulation of the European Union (GDPR). This privacy policy may be amended at any time without prior notice. We may also inform you separately about the processing of your data (e.g., in terms and conditions, additional privacy statements, consent forms, etc.).

responsible.title: 1. Responsible Party
responsible.content: Responsible for data processing on this website is:

collection.title: 2. Collection and Processing of Personal Data
collection.intro: We primarily collect and process personal data that you provide to us in the context of your business relationship or use of our services (e.g., buying and selling teaching materials by teachers). Additional personal data may come from publicly available sources (such as the internet) or from authorities.

payment.title: Payment Data
payment.note: We do not store credit card numbers, TWINT account details, or other sensitive payment credentials on our servers.

serverLogs.title: Server Log Data
serverLogs.intro: Currico automatically collects and stores information in server log files that your browser transmits to us:

items.ip: IP address of the accessing computer

serverLogs.note: This data cannot be assigned to specific persons by us. This data is not merged with other data sources. The data is deleted after statistical evaluation.

thirdPartyData.title: Data from Third Parties
thirdPartyData.content: If you transmit data about other persons to us, we assume that you are authorized to do so and that this data is correct. By transmitting data about third parties, you confirm this and ensure that these third parties have been informed about this privacy policy.

purpose.title: 3. Purpose of Data Processing
purpose.intro: Your personal data is used by us to conclude and process business relationships. We also process personal data to protect our legitimate interests:

items.account: Providing and managing your user account
items.communication: Communication with users and processing inquiries
items.improvement: Offering and developing our services and platform
items.marketing: Advertising and marketing, unless you have objected to the use of your data
items.legal: Asserting legal claims and defense in legal disputes
items.security: Ensuring IT security and preventing misuse
items.compliance: Compliance with legal and regulatory obligations

purpose.consent: We process your personal data based on your consent, unless another legal basis exists. You can revoke your consent to data processing at any time. A revocation has no effect on data processing that has already taken place.
purpose.serviceProviders: We use service providers for the operation and maintenance of our websites who act as our data processors. All service providers are contractually obligated to treat your data confidentially.
purpose.securityMeasures: Currico uses various technical and organizational measures to protect your personal data from unauthorized access, misuse, disclosure, alteration, or destruction.

cookies.title: 4. Data Processing on Our Websites, Cookies and Tracking
cookies.intro: The Currico websites use so-called cookies in several places. Most of the cookies we use are so-called 'session cookies'. They are automatically deleted at the end of your visit. Cookies are small pieces of text information that are stored in your browser and are also available on subsequent visits. This allows us to correctly restore your settings (e.g., your language) on your next visit.
cookies.noPersonalData: The cookie itself does not contain any personal data.

essential.title: Essential Cookies
essential.content: These cookies are necessary for the website to function. They enable basic features like login and language preferences.

analytics.title: Analytics Cookies (optional)
analytics.content: With your consent, we use analytics cookies to understand how visitors use our website. This data helps us improve the site.

cookies.browserSettings: In most browsers, you can find settings to view and delete cookies. If you block cookies, certain functionalities (such as language selection, order processes) may no longer work.

paymentProcessors.title: 5. Payment Processors
paymentProcessors.intro: We use the following third-party payment processors to handle transactions securely:

stripe.title: Stripe
stripe.content: Stripe, Inc. processes credit card payments and seller payouts. When you make a payment, Stripe collects your payment card data directly. Stripe is certified to PCI Service Provider Level 1, the most stringent level of certification.
stripe.dataShared: Data shared with Stripe: Email address, billing address, transaction amount, IP address.
stripe.location: Data processing location: Stripe may process data in the USA. Stripe participates in the EU-US Data Privacy Framework.

twint.title: TWINT
twint.content: TWINT AG processes mobile payments for Swiss customers. When you pay with TWINT, you authorize the payment through your TWINT app.
twint.dataShared: Data shared with TWINT: Transaction amount, merchant identifier.

sharing.title: 6. Data Sharing
sharing.intro: We do not sell your data. We share your data only with the following service providers:

items.stripe: Stripe - for secure payment processing (USA, with EU-US Data Privacy Framework)
items.hosting: Hosting provider - servers are located in Switzerland
items.email: Email service provider - for transactional emails

storage.title: 7. Data Storage and International Transfers
storage.location: We process and store personal data primarily in Switzerland and in the European Union (EU). Through data processors or subcontractors of our service providers, data may also be processed in other countries.
storage.transfer: If a recipient is located in a country without adequate legal data protection, we contractually oblige the recipient to comply with applicable data protection. We use the Standard Contractual Clauses of the European Commission for this purpose, unless the recipient is already subject to a legally recognized framework for ensuring data protection.
storage.retention: We process and store your personal data only as long as necessary for the fulfillment of our contractual and legal obligations. Data that we need for the processing of our business relationships is generally retained for 10 years from the last exchange with you, but at least from the end of the contract. This period may be longer if required for evidentiary purposes or to comply with legal requirements.

rights.title: 8. Your Rights Regarding the Processing of Personal Data
rights.intro: You can request information about whether we process your personal data at any time free of charge. You can also contact us if you wish to:

items.access: Obtain information about your stored data
items.deletion: Have your data deleted ('right to be forgotten')
items.objection: Object to our processing of your personal data

rights.limitations: Statutory restrictions such as legal retention and documentation obligations may be asserted by us.
rights.contact: To exercise these rights, please contact us at info@currico.ch. We will respond within 30 days.
rights.complaint: Complaints about our processing of your personal data can be submitted to the Swiss Federal Data Protection and Information Commissioner (FDPIC), Feldeggweg 1, 3003 Bern.
rights.euComplaint: If you are located in the European Economic Area (EEA), you also have the right to lodge a complaint with the data protection supervisory authority in your country.
rights.profileDeletion: Registered users can permanently delete their profile. After deletion, they are no longer reachable or identifiable through the platform.

security.title: 9. Data Security
security.content: We implement technical and organizational security measures to protect your data from unauthorized access, loss, or misuse. This includes TLS encryption for all data in transit, encrypted storage for sensitive data, secure servers, and regular security audits.

changes.title: 10. Changes to This Privacy Policy
changes.content: We may update this privacy policy from time to time. The current version is always available on this page. For significant changes, we will notify you by email.

jurisdiction.title: 11. Governing Law and Jurisdiction
jurisdiction.content: This Privacy Policy is governed by Swiss law. The exclusive place of jurisdiction for all disputes is Zurich, Switzerland.

gdpr.title: 12. Exceptional Application of the EU General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR)
gdpr.intro: The EU General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) is generally not applicable. However, if it exceptionally applies to certain data processing, the following legal bases apply exclusively for the purposes of the GDPR and data processing subject to it:

items.consent: Processing of personal data with the consent of the data subject (Art. 6(1)(a) GDPR)
items.contract: Processing of personal data necessary for the performance of a contract with the data subject and for the implementation of pre-contractual measures (Art. 6(1)(b) GDPR)
items.legal: Processing of personal data necessary for compliance with a legal obligation (Art. 6(1)(c) GDPR)
items.vital: Processing of personal data necessary to protect vital interests of the data subject or another natural person (Art. 6(1)(d) GDPR)
items.publicInterest: Processing of personal data necessary for the performance of a task carried out in the public interest or in the exercise of official authority (Art. 6(1)(e) GDPR)
items.legitimate: Processing of personal data necessary to protect the legitimate interests of us or third parties, unless overridden by the interests or fundamental rights and freedoms of the data subject, particularly if the data subject is a child (Art. 6(1)(f) GDPR)

gdpr.legitimateInterests: Legitimate interests include, in particular, being able to conduct our activities and operations permanently, securely, reliably, and in a user-friendly manner, ensuring information security, protection against misuse, enforcement of our own legal claims, and compliance with Swiss law.
gdpr.contactIfNotSatisfied: Contact us if you are not satisfied with how we handle your rights or data protection.

automatedDecisions.title: 13. Automated Individual Decisions and Profiling
automatedDecisions.content: Currico does not use automated decision-making processes, including profiling, that have legal effects on you or similarly significantly affect you. Should we introduce such processes in the future, we will inform you accordingly and obtain your consent where required.

minors.title: 14. Minors
minors.content: Our platform is aimed at teachers. Minors may only use the services with the consent of their legal guardians. We do not knowingly collect personal data from children under 16 years of age without parental consent.
